meanings.definition: Resembling or relating to a rhizoid.
meanings.sent1: The plant had rhizoidal roots spreading deep into the soil.
meanings.sent2: The moss's rhizoidal structures helped it anchor firmly to the rock.
meanings.sent3: The rhizoidal vines in the garden seemed to be playing a game of underground hide-and-seek.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts were like rhizoidal connections, branching out in unexpected directions.
meanings.sent5: The artist painted a vivid picture of the forest floor, capturing the intricate rhizoidal patterns.

meanings.sent1: The rhizoidal growth of the fungus allowed it to spread rapidly.
meanings.sent2: The scientist studied the rhizoidal structure of the algae under the microscope.
meanings.sent3: The rhizoidal texture of the carpet made it feel like walking on tiny roots.
meanings.sent4: The city's transportation system was like a rhizoidal network, connecting all neighborhoods.
meanings.sent5: The chef's dish was a masterpiece of flavors, each ingredient adding to the rhizoidal complexity of the taste.
